text: RC2 is out (or will be soon, not 100% sure). After that, 1.6 will be released in 1 week assuming no new bugs are found

text: Well, I found a segmentation fault yesterday that I made a ticket for.

elements.text: Well, I found a segmentation fault yesterday that I made a ticket for.

text:
It’s trivial to reproduce, but you need Docker to create this:
```FROM julia:1.6-buster

USER root
RUN useradd -ms /bin/bash arthur

USER arthur
WORKDIR /home/arthur

RUN julia -e "using Pkg; Pkg.add([\"JLD\",\"SnoopCompile\",\"AbstractTrees\",\"Profile\",\"PProf\"]); Pkg.precompile();"

CMD ["bash"]```
Then run this in julia
```using JLD, SnoopCompile, Pkg
tinf = @snoopi_deep Pkg.add("DataFrames")
JLD.save("tinf.jld", "tinf", tinf)```

elements.text: It’s trivial to reproduce, but you need Docker to create this:

FROM julia:1.6-buster

USER root
RUN useradd -ms /bin/bash arthur

USER arthur
WORKDIR /home/arthur

RUN julia -e "using Pkg; Pkg.add([\"JLD\",\"SnoopCompile\",\"AbstractTrees\",\"Profile\",\"PProf\"]); Pkg.precompile();"

CMD ["bash"]

using JLD, SnoopCompile, Pkg
tinf = @snoopi_deep Pkg.add("DataFrames")
JLD.save("tinf.jld", "tinf", tinf)

text: I don’t have 1.6 on host, so it’s possibly something in the docker image.

elements.text: I don’t have 1.6 on host, so it’s possibly something in the docker image.
